alert.note: Alert for Bosque; Coryell; Hood; Montague; Parker; Somervell; Wise (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 17 at 11:46PM CST until January 18 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM CST WEDNESDAY FOR VERY DRY, WARM, AND WINDY CONDITIONS ALONG AND WEST OF A LINE FROM BOWIE TO GRANBURY TO GATESVILLE... The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a Red Flag Warning for very dry, warm, and windy conditions which is in effect from noon to 8 PM CST Wednesday. * AFFECTED AREA...Areas along and west of a line from Bowie to Granbury to Gatesville * TIMING...Noon through 8 PM Wednesday * WINDS...West 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Between 15 and 18 percent * TEMPERATURES...Mid 60s to lower 70s * IMPACTS...Any wildfires that develop could be difficult to control and will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical to extreme fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and dry vegetation can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Avoid all outside burning and welding today. Do not toss lit cigarette butts outside. Report wild fires to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
